title: How do you get under or equal to 1.0 KDA?
body: How do you achieve KDAs like 0.21? I don't think I could do it if I tried.

replies.body:
Pretty much this.

And you have to basically feed outside team fights or you will likely get assist's and shit.

It's mostly those bronze laners who have fed 3 kills, and still think they can fight the enemy laner.

I'm just getting back into league after a month on holiday without playing and because before I left I did some placements, now I'm getting crushed in normals because I've gotten much worse and I have to admit, when playing a frontline champion, it's not altogether that difficult to get a low kda sometimes when your team is losing badly but you still need to tank and peel and try to make picks.

A lot of front liners have a really bad habit of charging the back line or engaging by themselves.
Just because you're the amumu and you've decided that now is the time to ult, doesn't mean your team agrees with you.

I play a lot of ARAMs, so I think this is a bigger issue there than on the rift possibly, just never flame your team for failing to follow up :P

When one person makes a decision that four people disagree with, it's the one person who made the mistake.
I don't flame. I get frustrated with them in real life but I'll be patient and nice and apologetic in chat.

I mean if your getting a low KDA on frontliners your either picking the wrong fights, or playing the wrong sort of champions.

Because remember, if you get 1 assist in a fight, you go even in KDA, even when you die.
the issue is when you try to peel an enemy off but because the game is like 2-27 so you generally get killed anyway.
I actually fail to understand any of this kda shit
How about average KDAs of their entire champion pool less than 3? Easy, firstly you get into a bronze game and then you join the other noobs to "chase like an arsehole" (Niki Lauda).
